alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, southwestern Lewis and eastern Oswego Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dexter to 9 miles west of Camden. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential Rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. These storms have a history of producing 1.5 to 2.0 inches of rain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Watertown, Fort Drum, West Carthage, Adams, Dexter, Redfield, Glen Park, Herrings, Adams Center, Barnes Corners, Richland, Constantia, Sackets Harbor, Black River, Smithville, Williamstown, Rodman, Orwell, Brownville, and Lorraine. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 37 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
